topic_tags.description: Represents the main topic or subject area of the customer's inquiry, helping route to appropriate knowledge sources and specialists.

tags.name: How-to
tags.description: Questions seeking step-by-step guidance or instructions on how to perform specific tasks, configure features, or use Atlan functionalities.

tags.name: Product
tags.description: General product-related inquiries about Atlan's features, capabilities, pricing, or overall functionality that don't fall into specific technical categories.

tags.name: Connector
tags.description: Questions related to Atlan's data connectors, including setup, configuration, troubleshooting, or compatibility with external data sources.

tags.name: Lineage
tags.description: Inquiries about data lineage features, tracking data flow, understanding data dependencies, or configuring lineage visualization in Atlan.

tags.name: API/SDK
tags.description: Technical questions about Atlan's API endpoints, SDK usage, integration development, authentication, or programmatic access to Atlan services.

tags.name: SSO
tags.description: Single Sign-On related queries including configuration, authentication issues, identity provider setup, or access management.

tags.name: Glossary
tags.description: Questions about Atlan's business glossary features, term management, metadata definitions, or data dictionary functionality.

tags.name: Best practices
tags.description: Requests for recommended approaches, optimization strategies, governance guidelines, or industry best practices for using Atlan effectively.

tags.name: Sensitive data
tags.description: Inquiries related to data privacy, PII handling, data classification, security measures, or compliance requirements within Atlan.

sentiment.description: Captures the emotional tone and urgency level of the customer's communication to help prioritize responses and tailor support approach.

tags.name: Frustrated
tags.description: Customer expresses frustration, disappointment, or dissatisfaction with current experience, often indicating urgent attention needed.

tags.name: Curious
tags.description: Customer shows positive engagement and genuine interest in learning more about features or capabilities, representing growth opportunities.

tags.name: Angry
tags.description: Customer displays strong negative emotions, complaints, or demands immediate resolution, requiring escalation and careful handling.

tags.name: Neutral
tags.description: Customer maintains a professional, matter-of-fact tone without strong emotional indicators, representing standard support interactions.

priority.description: Determines the urgency level and response timeline for customer tickets based on business impact and severity.

tags.name: P0 (High)
tags.description: Critical issues requiring immediate attention: system outages, data loss, security breaches, or blocking issues affecting business operations.

tags.name: P1 (Medium)
tags.description: Important issues that impact productivity but have workarounds: feature malfunctions, performance issues, or configuration problems.

tags.name: P2 (Low)
tags.description: Non-urgent requests that can be addressed within standard timelines: feature requests, general questions, or minor enhancements.
